etymology.description: Semantic: 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") + Phonetic: 卖(賣) (mài, "sell") = selling valuables -> sell
etymology.interpretation: 賣(賣) originally combines 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry"), a symbol of money and valuables in ancient China, with a phonetic component indicating the sound. Selling involved valuables, making the connection logical.
etymology.simplification: 賣(賣) → 卖(賣): The shell radical 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") was replaced by 单(單) (dān, "single") in a simplified phonetic and semantic reduction.

examples.chinese: 我去市场卖水果(我去市場賣水果)。
examples.english: I go to the market to sell fruit.

examples.chinese: 他卖友求荣(他賣友求榮)。
examples.english: He betrays his friends to seek glory.

examples.chinese: 他总是喜欢卖弄(他總是喜歡賣弄)，自己的才华(自己的才華)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì xǐhuān mài nòng, zìjǐ de cáihuá。
examples.english: He always likes to show off his talent.
